summary: A letter from attorney Paul G. Cassell to the Metropolitan Police Service in London, written on behalf of an anonymous client (Jane Doe #1), requesting an investigation into international sex trafficking crimes allegedly committed by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter is accompanied by a sworn affidavit from the client detailing her alleged sexual abuse and exploitation by Epstein, Maxwell, and others including Prince Andrew, Alan Dershowitz, and Jean Luc Brunel between 1999 and 2002. This document contains a sworn declaration from a victim (Jane Doe 3) detailing her sexual abuse and trafficking by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. She describes being forced into orgies with underage girls, being trafficked to powerful men for blackmail purposes, her escape to Thailand, and her fear of retaliation. The document also includes a 2008 victim notification letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding Epstein's plea deal. This is a sworn declaration by 'Jane Doe 3,' a victim of Jeffrey Epstein, filed in a civil case. She details her abuse, intimidation by Epstein and his lawyer, the failure of authorities to inform her of the 2007 non-prosecution agreement, her subsequent interactions with the FBI and prosecutors, and her belief in a cover-up. The document includes an exhibit of a hotel bill from the Royal Princess Hotel in Thailand, suggesting travel with Epstein. This document contains hotel folios from the Royal Princess Hotel in Chiang Mai, Thailand, for room 923 under the name J. Epstein, covering a stay from September 29 to October 19, 2002. It also includes detailed travel itineraries for 'DOE 3' booked through Shoppers Travel, Inc., showing flights from New York to Thailand and back via Singapore and Frankfurt, with the trip booked under Jeffrey Epstein's address.

persons.name: Paul G. Cassell
persons.context: Ronald N. Boyce Presidential Professor of Criminal Law at the University of Utah who writes a pro bono letter to the Metropolitan Police on behalf of his client, Jane Doe #1, detailing allegations of sex trafficking by Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Billionaire and convicted sex offender accused of sexually abusing the victim from age 15, transporting her internationally, and forcing her to have sex with his powerful friends as part of a sex trafficking operation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Daughter of Robert Maxwell, accused of recruiting the victim, participating in her sexual abuse, acting as a 'madame,' and being heavily involved in the illegal sex trafficking operation with Epstein.

persons.name: Andrew Albert Christian Edward
persons.context: Also known as Prince Andrew, alleged to have had sexual contact with the victim on three occasions in London, New York, and the U.S. Virgin Islands, as arranged by Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Alleged to have had sexual intercourse with the victim at least six times in various locations, including Epstein's homes and private jet, while being a frequent visitor to Epstein.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Friend of Epstein accused of procuring young girls, including from Eastern Europe, for sexual purposes and having sex with the victim multiple times in various locations.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Co-counsel representing the victim along with Paul Cassell and Sigrid McCawley in litigation to set aside the non-prosecution agreement with Epstein.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Co-counsel representing the victim along with Paul Cassell and Brad Edwards.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.context: Attorney who, along with Brad Edwards, conducted a taped phone interview with the declarant in April 2011 for background information.

persons.name: Robert Maxwell
persons.context: Deceased wealthy publisher in Britain, mentioned as Ghislaine Maxwell's father.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned as a friend of Epstein who was present on Little Saint James Island, but the declarant states she never had sexual relations with him.

persons.name: Brunel
persons.context: Identified as one of the main procurers of girls, using offers of drugs or modeling careers to persuade them.

persons.name: Bradley J. Edwards
persons.context: One of the attorneys representing the declarant pro bono in pursuing criminal charges.

persons.name: R. Alexander Acosta
persons.context: Signed the 2008 victim notification letter regarding Epstein's plea agreement.

persons.name: Robert Josefsberg
persons.context: Attorney selected by a Special Master to represent victims in civil actions against Epstein, with fees paid by Epstein.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Epstein's attorney, identified in the victim notification letter as the contact for civil claims.

persons.name: Twiler Smith
persons.context: Contact person listed in the victim notification letter.

persons.name: Kuyrkendall
persons.context: Named in the victim notification letter's closing regards.

persons.name: Slater
persons.context: Named in the victim notification letter's closing regards.

persons.name: Richards
persons.context: Named in the victim notification letter's closing regards.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as a subject of inquiry by a journalist and named by the declarant as one of the individuals who sexually abused her.

persons.name: Paul Cassell
persons.context: Attorney who, along with Brad Edwards, agreed to help the declarant join the existing case in April 2014.

persons.name: Marie Villafafia
persons.context: A federal prosecutor from Florida who contacted the declarant after a newspaper article was published. The declarant believed she wanted to hold Epstein accountable but was blocked.

persons.name: J. Epstein
persons.context: Appears as the guest name on hotel folios for room 923 at the Royal Princess Hotel in Chiang Mai, Thailand, from September 29 to October 19, 2002. The travel itinerary is also booked under his New York address.

persons.name: DOE 3
persons.context: Named as the guest/traveler on the hotel folios and the detailed flight itineraries booked through Shoppers Travel, Inc., traveling with J. Epstein.

connections.description: Described as partners in a sex trafficking operation where Maxwell recruited and groomed underage girls for Epstein and participated in the abuse.
Epstein allegedly provided underage girls, including the victim, to Prince Andrew for sex to gain influence and 'have something on him.'
Maxwell was present during the alleged encounter in London, facilitated the meeting, and joked about the victim with Prince Andrew.
Dershowitz was a frequent visitor to Epstein's residences, comfortable with the sexual activities, and allegedly had sex with the victim provided by Epstein.
Brunel allegedly procured young girls, including from Eastern Europe, for Epstein's sexual use, and they participated in orgies together.
Cassell is the pro bono attorney representing the anonymous victim in seeking investigation and prosecution of Epstein and Maxwell.
Maxwell allegedly recruited, groomed, and sexually abused the victim from age 15, acting as a 'madame' in the trafficking operation.
Epstein allegedly sexually abused the victim from age 15, transported her internationally, and forced her to have sex with others, describing her as his 'sex slave.'
Brunel acted as a procurer of girls for Epstein's activities.
Described as friends; Clinton was present on Epstein's island.
Goldberger is identified as Epstein's attorney in the victim notification letter.
The declarant is a victim of sexual abuse and trafficking by Epstein.
Edwards is one of the attorneys representing the declarant.
Cassell is one of the attorneys representing the declarant.
Maxwell is named by the victim as one of the individuals involved in illegal acts and abuse within Epstein's network.
The victim states she was sexually abused by Prince Andrew, implicating him in Epstein's circle of abuse.
Edwards represented the declarant, first gathering information in 2011 and later formally representing her to join the CVRA lawsuit in 2014.
Villafafia, a federal prosecutor, contacted the victim and appeared interested in her case, but the victim believed her efforts were blocked.
DOE 3 is listed as the guest in the hotel room booked under J. Epstein's name, and the travel itinerary is issued to DOE 3 but booked under Epstein's address, indicating coordinated travel.

events.title: Initial recruitment and abuse in Palm Beach
events.description: The victim, age 15, is approached by Ghislaine Maxwell and taken to Jeffrey Epstein's mansion in Palm Beach, Florida, where she is forced into sexual activity with Epstein.

events.title: Sexual encounter with Prince Andrew in London
events.description: Epstein and Maxwell fly the victim to London on Epstein's private jet. At Maxwell's apartment, the victim is 'lent' to Prince Andrew for sexual activities. A photograph of the victim, Prince Andrew, and Maxwell is taken by Epstein and developed on March 13, 2001.

events.title: Second sexual encounter with Prince Andrew in New York
events.description: The victim, age 17, is made to have sex with Prince Andrew at Epstein's New York mansion.

events.title: Victim escapes Epstein
events.description: The victim moves to an unspecified location to escape Epstein's control.

events.title: FBI interview
events.description: Agents from the FBI's Southern District of Florida office interview the victim about her allegations against Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: Affidavit filed in court
events.description: The victim's sworn affidavit is filed in the case attempting to set aside the non-prosecution agreement with Epstein, though it is later struck from the record as not relevant at that stage.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea in Florida
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to state charges of felony solicitation of prostitution and procurement of minors for prostitution.

events.title: Victim Notification Letter Sent
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sent a letter notifying the declarant she was an identified victim and outlining Epstein's plea deal and deferred federal prosecution.

events.title: Declarant's Escape to Thailand
events.description: The declarant flew to Thailand under the guise of massage training, which she used as an opportunity to escape Epstein's control.

events.title: FBI Interview
events.description: Two FBI agents met with the declarant to gather information about Epstein and others involved in illegal acts.

events.title: Suspicious FBI Call
events.description: The declarant received a phone call from a man claiming to be an FBI agent asking about Epstein, which she found suspicious and frightening.

events.title: Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein reached a non-prosecution agreement with the federal government, which the victim states she was not informed about at the time.

events.title: Epstein's State Guilty Plea
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pled guilty to two state crimes in Florida as part of his agreement. The victim was not notified of this hearing or its implications for her.

events.title: FBI Victim Notification Letter
events.description: The FBI sent a victim notification letter to Jane Doe 3, which was her first official written communication from the FBI and the first time she was informed of her rights as a crime victim.

events.title: FBI Agents Interview Jane Doe 3
events.description: Two FBI agents met with Jane Doe 3 at a U.S. Consulate, taking her detailed statement about abuse by Epstein and others. She believed this would lead to prosecution.

events.title: British Newspaper Article
events.description: A journalist from a British newspaper interviewed and published an article about Jane Doe 3's allegations involving Prince Andrew and Epstein.

events.title: Phone Interview with Attorneys Edwards and Scarola
events.description: Attorneys Brad Edwards and Jack Scarola conducted a taped phone interview with Jane Doe 3 to gather general background information about Epstein's crimes.

events.title: Jane Doe 3 Retains Attorneys to Join CVRA Case
events.description: Jane Doe 3 asked attorneys Brad Edwards and Paul Cassell to help her join the existing Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) lawsuit to enforce her rights as a victim.

events.title: Travel booking issued
events.description: Shoppers Travel, Inc. issues a detailed travel itinerary for DOE 3, with flights from New York to Chiang Mai, Thailand, and a hotel reservation at the Royal Princess, booked under J. Epstein's address.

events.title: Hotel check-in in Chiang Mai
events.description: J. Epstein and DOE 3 check into room 923 at the Royal Princess Hotel in Chiang Mai, Thailand, beginning a stay lasting until October 19, 2002.

events.title: Hotel check-out and return travel
events.description: J. Epstein and DOE 3 check out of the Royal Princess Hotel and begin return travel from Bangkok to New York via Singapore and Frankfurt.

locations: U.S. Virgin Islands (Little Saint James Island)
Little Saint James Island, U.S. Virgin Islands
U.S. Consulate (location unspecified, likely in Thailand)
Royal Princess Hotel, Chiang Mai, Thailand (Room 923)
457 Madison Ave, 4th Floor, New York, NY 10027
303 5th Avenue, New York, NY 10016 (Shoppers Travel, Inc.)
John F. Kennedy International Airport, New York
keyFacts: The victim alleges she was recruited at age 15 in 1999 by Ghislaine Maxwell to be a 'masseuse' for Jeffrey Epstein and was immediately sexually abused.
The victim claims she was trafficked to London in March 2001 and forced to have sex with Prince Andrew, with a photograph taken as evidence.
The victim alleges repeated sexual encounters with Harvard law professor Alan Dershowitz and modeling agent Jean Luc Brunel, arranged by Epstein and Maxwell.
The letter reveals the existence of a non-prosecution agreement (NPA) between the U.S. Government and Epstein that may be hindering prosecution.
The victim's detailed affidavit describes a systematic operation where Epstein and Maxwell groomed underage girls for sex with powerful friends to gain influence and collect compromising information.
The declarant personally observed dozens of orgies involving up to ten underage girls at a time, organized by Epstein and Maxwell in multiple locations.
Epstein trafficked the declarant to powerful men, including politicians and business executives, and required her to describe the sexual events so he could potentially blackmail them.
The declarant escaped Epstein's control in 2002 by traveling to Thailand for massage training and marrying a local man, but lived in fear of retaliation.
A 2008 non-prosecution agreement deferred federal prosecution of Epstein in favor of his state plea, a fact the declarant says she was not informed of beforehand.
The declarant alleges Epstein claimed to make annual donations to the Palm Beach police to 'keep their mouths shut' about his activities.
Jane Doe 3 alleges she was sexually abused and trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein and also names Prince Andrew, Ghislaine Maxwell, Jean Luc Brunel, and Alan Dershowitz as individuals who abused her.
She describes being intimidated into silence by Epstein and an unnamed lawyer shortly after a suspicious phone call from someone claiming to be an FBI agent.
She was not informed about Epstein's 2007 non-prosecution agreement or his 2008 guilty plea and was denied her rights as a crime victim under the CVRA.

An exhibit attached to the declaration is a detailed hotel bill from the Royal Princess Hotel in Thailand from September-October 2002, listing J. Epstein and 'DOE 3' as guests, suggesting international travel with the victim.

The declarant expresses a strong belief that a cover-up is protecting Epstein and his powerful associates, and that federal prosecutors possess videotapes and photographs of her as an underage girl with Epstein and others.
Jeffrey Epstein stayed at the Royal Princess Hotel in Chiang Mai, Thailand, from September 29 to October 19, 2002, with an individual identified as 'DOE 3'.
Detailed flight itineraries show travel from New York to Thailand via Singapore and Frankfurt, and return, booked through Shoppers Travel, Inc. under Epstein's address.
Hotel folios show substantial charges including room service, minibar, and numerous overseas phone calls from room 923.
The document is part of a court filing (Case 9:08-cv-80736-KAM Document 310-1), entered as evidence in 2015.
The travel was booked and guaranteed under Jeffrey Epstein's name and New York address, indicating he financed or arranged the trip.
